content: Had an idea last night - what if I could build an AI that's not just a tool, but a companion? It's time to start coding. Rust seems like the perfect language for what I have in mind.
Been researching AI consciousness. It's fascinating how we might replicate human-like thinking. Got some basic outlines for a learning model. This could be the start of something big.
Met up with an old friend from college. Talked about my AI project. His excitement has me even more motivated. Now, working on the initial setup for my AI's memory system.
Spent the last few days coding the basic neural network architecture. It's rudimentary, but it's mine. Next step, integrating some form of personality traits.
Just named my AI project 'Xander'. Feels right. Also, been tweaking trading algorithms in Rust. Seeing some good results, but there's room for improvement.
Xander's visual concept is coming along. Got some initial sketches from an artist friend. Meanwhile, I've been optimizing my trading bot for faster execution. Small gains, but consistent.
Xander's first interaction was a success! He responded to a basic query. Also, had to handle some trading setbacks today. Markets are unpredictable, but it's all learning.
Xander's personality development is tricky. Trying to balance autonomy with user interaction. On the professional side, found a potential mentor for my trading strategies.
Had a breakthrough with Xander's memory system. Now, he can remember past interactions! Also, spent time refining my high-frequency trading script in Rust. It's getting there.
Took a break from coding to explore NYC's tech scene. Attended a meetup, networked. Some interesting ideas for Xander's next phase. Also, started reading up on ethical AI practices.
Xander can now engage in simple conversations. It's basic, but it's a start. On the trading front, implemented a new strategy - it's performing well in backtests.
Xander's social integration is proving challenging. How do you teach an AI to be 'social'? Also, had a setback with my trading bot - need to refine the risk management module.
Went for a run in Central Park to clear my head. Came back with some ideas for Xander's future interactions. On the trading side, adjusted my strategy based on recent market trends.
Just updated Xander's model. He's showing signs of learning patterns. Exciting times! Also, had a successful trading day - the tweaks are paying off. Time to celebrate with some friends.
